result.execSummary:
The defendant Mike A Chand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is ordered in the amount of $2,195.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim (Hop It Market).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion.

Defendant Mike A Chand in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as charged in the information. Court imposed the following sentence:

Total sentence of 2 1/2 years, 1 1/2 yr Initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision STAYED and place on probation for 2 years
CONDITIONS: 
 Agent to determine if any treatment is needed
 No contact with the victim (Hop It Market)
 Maintain full time employment
 Provide DNA sample by 07/06/2015
 Court costs of $268.00, $10.00 DRGOD and $250.00 DNA sample
 Restitution in the amount of $2195.00 
 Condition time of 60 days huber STAYED
 Probation maybe transferred to Milwaukee County
